snippet: Blue clay strikes Rafael Nadal and others as an innovation too far, an unnecessary risk that could disrupt the rhythms of players accustomed to the red stuff.
lead_paragraph: The clay will be blue at the Madrid Open this year, and that has Rafael Nadal seeing red. Tennis champions, particularly those as ritualistic as Nadal, are often resistant to change. Why embrace anyone's tinkering with the domain you rule? Roger Federer, at the height of his dominance, was no fan of electronic line calling when it was introduced in 2006 and has been challenging it with little enthusiasm and limited success ever since.

headline.main: Nadal Is No Fan of the New Blue Clay Courts in Madrid
